meanings.definition: The point on which a lever rests or is supported and on which it pivots.
meanings.sent1: The fulcrums of the seesaw allow it to move up and down.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic adjusted the fulcrums of the machine to make it work smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy thought the fulcrums of the gate were perfect for scratching.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as the fulcrums that balanced the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The fulcrums of the decision were carefully considered before making a choice.

meanings.definition: A thing that plays a central or essential role in an activity, event, or situation.
meanings.sent1: In a team, trust is the fulcrums that hold everyone together.
meanings.sent2: Education is often seen as the fulcrums for success in life.
meanings.sent3: The delicious cake became the fulcrums of the party, disappearing in minutes.
meanings.sent4: His leadership skills acted as the fulcrums that drove the project to completion.
meanings.sent5: The fulcrums of kindness can create a ripple effect of positivity in the world.
